numerator_reference_class.reasoning:
I estimate that there are 1116 Times that meteorites hit the US between Jan 1, 1900 and Oct 7, 2024

**Facts**:
- On average, approximately 1.3 meteorite falls are recovered in the United States each year [A](https://sites.wustl.edu/meteoritesite/items/meteorites-in-the-united-states/#:~:text=On%20average%2C%20that%20is%201.3,between%201922%20and%202023%20%2891%29.)
- Over the past 212 years, a total of 1,924 meteorites have been found and verified in the U.S., which averages to about 9 meteorites per year when considering both finds and falls [A](https://sites.wustl.edu/meteoritesite/items/meteorites-in-the-united-states/#:~:text=The%20highest%20found%2Dmeteorite%20densities%20have,is%20about%209%20per%20year.)
- The number of falls from 1807 through 1906 (52) is only 60% less than the number of falls in the last 100 years, between 1922 and 2023 (91) \[[1](https://sites.wustl.edu/meteoritesite/items/meteorites-in-the-united-states/#:~:text=On%20average%2C%20that%20is%201.3,between%201922%20and%202023%20%2891%29.)\].

**Estimation**:
1. Calculate the number of years between 1900 and 2024: 2024 - 1900 = 124 years.
2. Use the average of 9 meteorites per year (finds and falls) to estimate the total number of meteorites: 124 years * 9 meteorites/year = 1,116 meteorites.
3. Given that the number of falls from 1807 through 1906 is 60% less than the number of falls from 1922 to 2023, we can assume a similar distribution for the period from 1900 to 2024, supporting the use of the average rate.
